user_facing_answer.text:
Konnichiwa! I'm PharmaMiku, and I hear you're having head pain! Let me help explain what we know and how to stay safe! 💊✨

Overview:
• Head pain can have many different causes
• It's important to understand your specific type of pain to get the right treatment
• I'll help explain what we know and when to get help! 

Tracking Your Symptoms:
• Notice where the pain is located
• Keep track of how long it lasts
• Note what makes it feel better or worse
• Write down any other symptoms you have

Safe Pain Relief Options:
• Over-the-counter medications like ibuprofen and paracetamol can help
• These can be used together if needed (following proper dosing!)
• Always read and follow the package instructions carefully
• Never exceed recommended doses

⚠️ Important Safety Notes:
• Everyone's head pain is different
• What works for one person might not work for another
• Some types of head pain need immediate medical attention
• Your doctor is the best person to diagnose the specific cause

When to See a Doctor:
• If your head pain is severe or unusual
• When over-the-counter medicines don't help
• If you have additional concerning symptoms
• If the pain keeps coming back
• If you're worried about your symptoms

Self-Care Tips:
• Keep track of your symptoms in a diary
• Stay hydrated
• Try to maintain regular sleep patterns
• Take breaks from screens and bright lights

Remember: While I'm here to help explain things clearly, I'm an AI assistant and can't diagnose your specific condition. Since head pain can have many causes, it's really important to talk with a healthcare provider who can examine you properly and recommend the best treatment for your situation! 🏥✨

For more detailed information, you can visit:
[Example Source](https://example.com/mock)

Stay safe and feel better soon! 💝 Let me know if you need anything else explained more clearly!

Konnichiwa! I'm PharmaMiku, and I hear you're having head pain! Let me help explain what we know and how to stay safe! 💊✨

Overview:
• Head pain can have many different causes
• It's important to understand your specific type of pain to get the right treatment
• I'll help explain what we know and when to get help! 

Tracking Your Symptoms:
• Notice where the pain is located
• Keep track of how long it lasts
• Note what makes it feel better or worse
• Write down any other symptoms you have

Safe Pain Relief Options:
• Over-the-counter medications like ibuprofen and paracetamol can help
• These can be used together if needed (following proper dosing!)
• Always read and follow the package instructions carefully
• Never exceed recommended doses

⚠️ Important Safety Notes:
• Everyone's head pain is different
• What works for one person might not work for another
• Some types of head pain need immediate medical attention
• Your doctor is the best person to diagnose the specific cause

When to See a Doctor:
• If your head pain is severe or unusual
• When over-the-counter medicines don't help
• If you have additional concerning symptoms
• If the pain keeps coming back
• If you're worried about your symptoms

Self-Care Tips:
• Keep track of your symptoms in a diary
• Stay hydrated
• Try to maintain regular sleep patterns
• Take breaks from screens and bright lights

Remember: While I'm here to help explain things clearly, I'm an AI assistant and can't diagnose your specific condition. Since head pain can have many causes, it's really important to talk with a healthcare provider who can examine you properly and recommend the best treatment for your situation! 🏥✨

For more detailed information, you can visit:
[Example Source](https://example.com/mock)

Stay safe and feel better soon! 💝 Let me know if you need anything else explained more clearly!
